nodes.bodyText: I know this was already here, but won't searchable always be true because of this? Similar question with dataFormat above.

The dataFormat attribute is meant to be a function to be used for rendering.  So the if check determines if the property is set otherwise use the default format.  Since searchable is meant to be a boolean that is a problem.  I need to change the logic to see if the property is defined otherwise default to true.
We might have this exact function in another utility class. May be useful importing and using it
I think we may have talked about creating a utility for this, but I'm not finding a utility for the change event.
I think you're right. Just took a quick look and didn't see any. Perhaps it's a nice future change.
This can also be changed to the util handleChange
Any specific reason we changed to this type of increment?

eslint rule does not like ++ it recommends in this case +=.
Example:
increment x by y
x = x + y equivalent to x += y here in our case y = 1
We may be able to replace this handle change as well
Can all of these if checks be condensed into 1?

Instead of creating 2 complete differnt TableHeaderColumn objects, we should change this to create a single one, but pass it different values to dataFormat and children. This would cut down on needing to change multiple places if we need to change the look of this column.
we push it into an array of table columns.  They need to be separate object instances.  I will create a function that will return a new instance.
